document_title: Coronary artery stenosis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: hep-mach-vanh.json_6_How to prevent coronary artery stenosis
subsection_content:
You can't always prevent coronary heart disease. Because some risk factors are beyond your control. However, there are many things you can do to minimize your risk of getting the disease and stop it from getting worse:
Quit smoking whether you are a new smoker or have smoked for many years;; Build a heart-healthy diet menu: limit greasy fried foods, sweets, salty foods, canned foods, and processed foods; Prioritize steamed/boiled foods, fruits and vegetables, fatty fish, olive oil, lean meat...; Get enough sleep: 7-9 hours every night;; Maintain a reasonable weight (BMI < 23);; Limit alcohol use;; Be active: Try to exercise 150 minutes/week. Good exercises for cardiovascular disease are walking, swimming, cycling, yoga...;; Early screening for coronary artery disease (especially those with many risk factors) to detect the disease early and have timely treatment.

Built according to the standards of the world's leading hospitals, specializing in performing interventional cardiac catheterization procedures for cases of acute myocardial infarction, arterial stenosis, peripheral vascular disease, arrhythmia, and heart disease. natural…
In particular, the Center always applies high technology according to the highest standards in the world, helping to increase treatment effectiveness and shorten the recovery process for patients.
Coronary artery stenosis cannot be cured or absolutely prevented, but you can control the disease and prevent its progression by complying with your doctor's treatment, maintaining a healthy diet and lifestyle, and at the same time. Regular medical examination and screening k.
